name: Castle Marne Bed & Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed here one night with my grown daughter while on a road trip of my through the Colorado Rockies, with a final night in my "native" city of Denver. Not only is the inn perfect for romance (honeymoons and anniversaries), but for those wishing to experience "living history" of early Denver, as we were doing. The twin-bedded Tower room (with private bath across the hall) is good for those not in the "romance" department, if you're staying with a relative or friend. Wonderful food-afternoon tea and breakfast; hosts. We had a rental car, but the inn seems to be very convenient to RTD bus line to get to downtown and other attractions easily.
reviews.title: Romance + Living Denver History

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed the Castle - the building is gorgeous, the interior is full of great Victorian detail. We had a bedroom and a small sitting room, very nice. The breakfasts will make you fat if you eat them for too long (it's excellent but very rich; one or two days won't kill you), but if you want to negotiate oatmeal, they do very good oatmeal too.
reviews.title: Great food, great location, great people!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The owners and staff are friendly, helpful, and know some wonderful restaurants.
reviews.title: Stayed for our honeymoon in 2000, returned for our anniversary in 2010

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very well taken care of at the Castle Marne! The accomadations are wonderful, a large victorian style castle made into a warm and home-like place to stay. Don't look for a huge bar and dance floor nor a TV. You come here to enjoy the person you are with and the other people staying at the B+B, and the owners and their family. Come be a part of their family for a night and a great breakfast. Lovely place for rest and relaxation right in the middle of the bustle of downtown Denver. Keep it up Castle Marne!
reviews.title: The Castle Marne is Top Notch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Castle Marne is a very enchanting and lovely place for a nice getaway. The ambience and history is wonderful and the people are absolutely the perfect hosts. The food was out of this world. I hope that I will be able to go back
reviews.title: Amazing hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is truly a great little hotel in Denver. The Peiker family give a service second to none and we would have no hesitation recommending this hotel to anyone. From the moment we arrived, to the moment we left, we were made to feel very welcome and it was nice to stay in a hotel that felt more like a home. Definitely a place to stay if you want to get away from the big hotel chains.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010
reviews.text: From the moment my two sisters and I arrived in Castle Marne we knew that we were in a fabulous B&B. I look forward to seeing my children and grandchildren there. The people who run it are a family of such fine people. They are filled with the history of Colorado, recommend the finest tours, art museums, restaurants. The Castle Marne is a sight to behold. It is exquisite and yet we were made to feel totally at home there. The rooms are beautiful and very comfortable. Lush terrycloth robes are provided. Breakfast and high tea were wonderful. Wonderful conversations were had with other guests over morning breakfast and evenings in the beautiful living room if you chose. Fresh flowers,
reviews.title: Castle Marne is what I always dreamed a Bed & Breakfast to be.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: a swing on the porch. I cannot think of one thing I would change. I will recommend it to anyone I know who is travelling to Colorado. And I hope to give it as gifts!
reviews.title: Castle Marne is a keeper!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rita Maloney Brooklyn, New York
reviews.title: An unforgetable B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: We looked for a unique weekend experience when we planned a recent business-related trip to Denver, and we're from the Bay Area, where we live in a Victorian home, so we're pretty picky. Castle Marne turned out to be a treasure in every way. We were treated like family by our hosts, one of the nicest families anywhere, we met two couples at breakfast who live nearby in CA and our former FL location, and we look forward to coming back to Castle Marne for fun, not business, next time. No question about where we'll stay, or the place we'd recommend to anyone traveling to Denver who likes wonderful people and a beautiful place.
reviews.title: A Step into the Past

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010
reviews.text: My sister and I stayed at Castle Marne for one night when we flew to Denver to see the Tut/Pharoahs exhibit. What a wonderful escape just blocks from Downtown and Capitol Hill.
reviews.title: Inviting, Comfortable, Homey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we showed up, we were given the grand tour (to include the amazing peacock stained glass window), the keys to our room, and permission to peek into any room that had an open door. The entire place was charming and cozy. Iced tea and snacks were available just outside the dining room, to be replaced later with cookies and coffee.
reviews.title: A Denver B&B Jewel: great ambiance, food, hosts & restful sleep!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Tower Room, which was quite large and extremely comfortable. I spent the evening reading the entries left behind by previous occupants who raved about the breakfasts and the comfortable beds. By the next morning I was sold.
reviews.title: Fantastic !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed was as comfortable as everyone raved. Breakfast was homemade mini muffins with the best jelly/jam I ever tasted, Artichoke/Broccoli/Swiss quiche, fruit and edible flowers. My sister said the coffee was incredible.
reviews.title: A Charming Castle with a Warm Family Feel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Given the opportunity, I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: Lovely and endearing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In addition to the private hot tub under Denver's cool starry night, the stay on our first anniversary at Castle Marne was welcoming and interesting. The family works to make you feel comfortable and share their vast knowledge about the area to make the rest of your time more enjoyable.
reviews.title: Romantic and Interesting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Castle Marne for one evening to have an evening to ourselves as we were staying with family for our trip to Colorado. We chose the Raymond Room, it was a cozy corner room and was very private at the end of the hall. The bed was quite comfy but the best part was the large private balcony. The balcony was actually larger than the room itself which is nice for those cool Colorado summer evenings. The balcony had its own table and chairs and jacuzzi. Nothing beats a long day of exploring like relaxing in the Jacuzzi under the stars.
reviews.title: A romantic stay in a castle in a city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Castle Marne is in a cute part of Denver with historic Victorian style homes. You can walk or take a short drive over to the Capitol and Mint, and also to nearby dining.
reviews.title: Completely charming!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was delicious and you can tell that the Peiker Family really cares about their guests. They tended to our every need and were very polite and lovely.
reviews.title: Do You Love Attention?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: We have never stayed at a B&B before and this first experience was a delightful surprise!
reviews.title: The Peiker and Feher-Peiker Family know how to take care of their guests.

description: Historic Castle Marne is a Bed and Breakfast inn in Denver, CO .Serving breakfasts, luncheons, teas and 4 course dinners as well as offering 9 luxurious rooms each with private bath.The building is a nationally and locally designated historic landmark made from Rhyolite (Lava Stone) from nearby Castle Rock quarries.Each room is uniquely decorated with historically significant pieces in this one-of-a-kind mansion which was lovingly restored.In-house wedding planner and wedding officiant can assist in planning and celebrating the romantic elopement or small wedding of your dreams.
